Task.description: Verify levels engine oil, hydraulic oil, fuel, engine coolant
Ensure all engine safety guards are in place and secure
Inspect engine belts and pulleys
Visual check for fluid leaks around and under machine
Check neutral start switch
Inspect instrument panel gauges, verify indication
Check for operators manual and parts book
Check, fire extinguisher, flagging kit, first aid kit
Verify brake operation ( parking, work and travel )
Check operation of C.N. radio
Check lights, flashers, wipers, mirrors, back up alarm and horn
Check machine for cracks and structural damage
Check safety decals are visible ( clean if dirty )
Visually inspect brake assembly
Clean deck & cab of grease, oil, dirt & garbage
Inspect exhaust system, intake system for leaks
Check fuel level ( end of shift )
Check all safety locks are secured and in place
Check brake chamber caging bolts
Inspect air cleaner dust unloading valve
Lubricate machine
Drain fuel water separator
Check hydraulic return filter indicator ( operating temperature and full R.P.M. )
Check workhead safety locks and roll pins are secure
Check hydraulic workhead motor adapter bolts are secure
Check workhead lift cylinder nut is secure
Check workhead limit switches are secure
Inspect workhead pivot block retaining bolt (secure), bushings are tight and greased
Check workhead bumper bolts for wear and adjust if necessary
Check workhead oil level and lines for leaks
Check tamping tools for wear and condition
Inspect rail clamp pins, jack cylinder pins, workhead pins and grease
Check operation and pressure setting of the shadow board reference cylinder regulator
Check front drive sprocket bolts are secure
Check front transmission limit switch linkage and control
Check rear transmission shift linkage and neutral switch
Check liner front and rear buggy springs, hinges and wheels turn freely
Check liner receiver and projector guide rollers turn freely
Check operation of liner and surface actuator
Check proper operation of jack and liner system's differential
Inspect hydraulic pumps, motors, valves, cylinders and fittings for leaks
Check battery level, cables, clamps, frame ground and clean
Check radiator, fan and hydraulic oil cooler for dirt and damage
Check transmission(s) oil levels
Check hydraulic filler cap, filler hose is capped, and inspection cover seal
Inspect drive chain and adjust if necessary
Check rail clamp stabilizer arm ( must be straight )
Lubricate brake pivot shaft
Check electrical cabinets and ensure components are secure
Check dynamic brake setting and squeeze pressure
Extend workhead traverse and check for pinching of hoses and cables
Check hydraulic pump drive oil level, clean breather if necessary
Check projector spacer buggy wheels roll freely, damaged electrical cables, connectors and bent pins
Check receivers for dust on lenses
Ensure workhead bumper stop "flow control valves@" are correctly adjusted
Check fire extinguisher condition and tag expiry date
Change engine oil, oil filter and fuel filters
Ensure engine emergency shutdown mechanism is functional
Test hydraulic emergency pump
Check air compressor filter and service as necessary
Check air compressor coolant lines
Inspect engine crankcase breather for air flow
Check engine cooling system ( leaks, connections and damage )
Ensure engine and radiator mounts are secure
Check drive wheels for wear, sharp flanges and cracks
Check hydraulic hoses for damage and verify hold downs are secure
Drain 1/4 liter of fuel from tank ( if adapted for quick drain )
Inspect engine wiring and connections for looseness and corrosion
Inspect turbocharger mountings, intake and exhaust ducts and connections for leaks
Check air conditioner condenser and filter for dirt
Check traverse chain adjustment , oil lightly and check rollers for free rolling
Clean projector and receiver lenses and check focus
Change workhead oil and clean magnetic plug
Grease axle suspension slides
Check front transmission control linkage for wear
Check projector spacer buggy wheels roll freely
Check projector buggies for frayed electrical cables, damaged connectors, bent pins
Check drive chains and sprockets for alignment
Drain and replace pump gear drive oil
Drain and replace transmission(s) oil
Check air dryer element, replace cartridge if necessary
Inspect engine cooling system for contamination and test anti freeze rating
Replace hydraulic return line filter
Replace hydraulic tank breather filter if necessary
Replace coolant filter if applicable
Replace fuel water separator filter
Inspect hydraulic top up pump for proper operation and change filter
Perform CN/Fairmont Tamper co-inspection of the machine
